Module com.example.granny_gains_new
Package com.example.granny_gains_new.database

Class DatabaseConnection

java.lang.Object
com.example.granny_gains_new.database.DatabaseConnection
public class DatabaseConnection extends Object
This class is responsible for managing the database connection using the Singleton pattern. It ensures that only one instance of the database connection is created and used across the application. The database schema is executed on the first connection to create the required tables.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method

    This method closes the database connection.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Connection getInstance()
      This method returns the singleton instance of the Connection. It establishes a new connection if one does not already exist or if it is closed.
      Returns:
      Connection instance - the singleton database connection.

    • closeConnection

      public static void closeConnection()
      This method closes the database connection. It should be called when the application is shutting down to release the database resources.

    • insertMeal

      public static void insertMeal(String recipeName, String description, int servings, int calories, String pictureUrl)
      Inserts a new meal into the database with the provided details.
      Parameters:
      recipeName - the name of the recipe for the meal
      description - a description of the meal
      servings - the number of servings for the meal
      calories - the total calories in the meal
      pictureUrl - the URL of the picture associated with the meal

    • insertFavoriteExercise

      public static void insertFavoriteExercise(String userId, int exerciseId)
      Inserts a new favorite exercise for a user into the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user adding the exercise to favorites
      exerciseId - the unique identifier of the exercise to be added to favorites
